{
    "number": 129744,
    "data": "2,4,14,32,82,196,478,1152,2786,6724,16238,39200,94642,228484,551614,1331712,3215042,7761796,18738638,45239072,109216786,263672644,636562078,1536796800,3710155682,8957108164,21624372014,52205852192",
    "name": "a(n) = -(u^n-1)*(v^n-1) with u = 1+sqrt(2), v = 1-sqrt(2).",
    "link": [
        "G. Everest et al., <a href=\"http://www.jstor.org/stable/27642221\">Primes generated by recurrence sequences</a>, Amer. Math. Monthly, 114 (No. 5, 2007), 417-431.",
        "<a href=\"/index/Di#divseq\">Index to divisibility sequences</a>"
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(2n) = A002203(2n)-2. a(2n+1) = A002203(2n+1). - _R. J. Mathar_, corrected Dec 05 2007.",
        "G.f.: 2*x*(1+x^2)/((x^2+2*x-1)*(-1+x)*(1+x)).",
        "From _Peter Bala_, Mar 19 2015: (Start)",
        "a(n) = -det(I - M^n) where I is the 2X2 identity matrix and M = [2, 1; 1, 0]. Cf. A001350.",
        "a(n) = 2*A113224(n-1).",
        "This is divisibility sequence, that is, if n | m then a(n) | a(m).",
        "exp( Sum_{n >= 1} a(n)*x^n/n ) = 1 + 2*Sum_{n >= 1} Pell(n) *x^n. (End)"
    ],
    "maple": [
        "u:=1+sqrt(2): v:=1-sqrt(2): a:=n->expand(-(u^n-1)*(v^n-1)): seq(a(n),n=1..33); # _Emeric Deutsch_, May 13 2007"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "Table[Simplify[ -((1 + Sqrt[2])^n - 1)*((1 - Sqrt[2])^n - 1)], {n, 1, 30}] (* _Stefan Steinerberger_, May 15 2007 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) w = quadgen(8); vector(30, n, -((1+w)^n-1)*((1-w)^n-1)) \\\\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 21 2015",
        "(PARI) Vec(2*x*(1+x^2)/((x^2+2*x-1)*(-1+x)*(1+x))+O(x^99)) \\\\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 13 2015"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A002003, A000129, A001350, A113224."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy,changed",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_N. J. A. Sloane_, May 13 2007",
    "ext": [
        "More terms from _Emeric Deutsch_ and _Stefan Steinerberger_, May 13 2007"
    ],
    "references": 2,
    "revision": 23,
    "time": "2018-02-21T16:54:05-05:00",
    "created": "2007-11-10T03:00:00-05:00"
}
